name: Cruzin
tag_list: boats, boats-for-rent, boating-industry, peer-to-peer, boater-to-boater, cruzin, cruzin-com
overview:
Cruzin is a privately held company headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, FL. Cruzin is the first company in the United States to offer fully-insured peer-to-peer boat rentals. The company is described as a boater-to-boater™ rental and charter marketplace.

Cruzin was founded in October of 2012 in San Francisco, CA. In the midst of accelerated growth in the peer-to-peer marketplace models such as Airbnb and others, Cruzin was founded with the aim of helping people find pre-screened boats for rent across the United States. The company’s initial investment came through angel investors in the US and Switzerland.

The beta version of the site went live in March of 2013.

Cruzin is an online marketplace where people interested in finding a boat for rent within the United States can sign up, go through a background check, choose a boat, book it and process payment directly through the site. Boat owners are able to list their boats with pictures and description, go through a screening process, communicate with potential renters and collect payment, directly through the site. Boat owners are protected by $1,000,000 in hull and liability insurance and towing services are provided by BoatUS.
